ORDER

The petitioner is the second accused in the case C.C No.
1167/2018 on the file of the Court of the Additional Chief Judicial
Magistrate (Economic Offences), Ernakulam.

2. The offences alleged against the petitioner are under
Section 420 read with 34 IPC and also under Section 10 read with
24(1)(a) and (b) of the Emigration Act, 1983.

3. The prosecution case is as follows: The first accused
conducted an institution for recruitment of persons for job abroad.
There was no licence or certificate obtained by the first accused for
conducting the recruitment agency. The passports of many persons
were obtained and kept in the office of the establishment of the first
accused. The passports were obtained from job aspirants on the
promise that job would be arranged for them abroad. No job was
arranged for any person. When some persons wanted to get back their
passports, money was demanded for returning the passport.

4. The case was registered suo motu by the Sub Inspector,

Pane

Crl.MC.No.1503 OF 2019(G) 2020/KER/12
3

Ernakulam Town South Police Station after conducting search of the
establishment of the first accused and seizing passports of many
persons from there. After completing investigation, chargesheet was
filed against the first accused and the petitioner for the offences
mentioned above.

5. This petition is filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C by the second
accused for quashing the proceedings against him in the case.

6. Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and the learned
Public Prosecutor.

7. Learned counsel for the petitioner would contend that there
is absolutely no material produced by the prosecution to prove that
the petitioner had dishonestly induced any person to part with his
passport or that he had promised any person that he would get job for
him abroad and therefore, the offences alleged against the petitioner
will not lie against him.

8. Admittedly, the petitioner was only a_ staff of the
establishment conducted by the first accused. I have perused the
copies of the statements of witnesses recorded by the investigating
officer. No witness has stated that the petitioner has made any
inducement to him to part with the passport. No witness has given
statement to the police that the petitioner had offered or promised

given any statement to the police that the petitioner had deceived him
in any manner. Even if it is accepted that, as a staff of the
establishment run by the first accused, the petitioner had obtained
and kept the passports of some persons in the office of the
establishment, it is not sufficient to implicate him in an offence
punishable under Section 420 IPC.

9. Admittedly, the petitioner is not the person who was
conducting the recruitment agency. Therefore, the offence alleged
against him under the Emigration Act will also not lie against him.
